response.label: I authorize any physician, hospital, pharmacy, pharmacy benefit manager, health insurance plan, insurer, any consumer reporting agency, the MIB Group, Inc (MIB) or any other entity that possesses any diagnosis, treatment, prescription or other medical information, personal information and data about me, to furnish such information to the Company, or its reinsurers, for the purpose of evaluating my eligibility for insurance.I authorize the Company, or its reinsurers, to make a report of my personal health information to MIB. This authorization overrides any restrictions that I may have in place with any entity regarding the release of my information. Health information obtained will not be re-disclosed without my authorization unless permitted by law, in which case it may not be protected under federal privacy rules.This authorization shall be valid for two years from this date and may be revoked by sending written notice to the Company.

Choose an LTC Benefit Period Each policy consists of an Extension of Benefits Rider (EOBR) that determine the duration of coverage once a claim begins.

Extension of Benefits for LTC The guaranteed LTC benefit and initial death benefit amounts are determined when your client applies for a policy, subject to approval by the issuing company. These amounts can grow based on the coverage option your client elects. Choose an Extension of Benefits for LTC Coverage Option
Brighthouse SmartCare:A hybrid product featuring life insurance and long-term care benefits that can grow, a Brighthouse SmartCare policy helps clients worry less about the unexpected.

response: Completing your SmartCare® application may take up to an hour. You don’t need to complete your application all at once. You can re-access your application using the link provided via email. Note, you will need to complete the identity verification and log-in process each time you access your application.
answer: Completing your SmartCare® application may take up to an hour. You don’t need to complete your application all at once. You can re-access your application using the link provided via email. Note, you will need to complete the identity verification and log-in process each time you access your application.
question_text: How long will it take to complete my SmartCare® application?

response:
Your financial professional provided some basic information about you, such as your address, social security number and similar details. You will need to review and confirm these details, and review several required disclosures.Your SmartCare® application involves reviewing and electronically signing forms which include; “User Consent to do Business with Brighthouse Financial and to Receive Documents Electronically,” and an “Authorization” form which describes how information about you is used and disclosed and complies with the requirements of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).

The last section of your SmartCare® application contains questions about your medical history. Once you complete this section, you will not have access to view or change the answers you provided. Finally, you’ll review and electronically sign forms which make up the application submitted to Brighthouse for review. After you sign these forms you will be able to download or print them for your records.
answer:
Your financial professional provided some basic information about you, such as your address, social security number and similar details. You will need to review and confirm these details, and review several required disclosures.Your SmartCare® application involves reviewing and electronically signing forms which include; “User Consent to do Business with Brighthouse Financial and to Receive Documents Electronically,” and an “Authorization” form which describes how information about you is used and disclosed and complies with the requirements of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).

The last section of your SmartCare® application contains questions about your medical history. Once you complete this section, you will not have access to view or change the answers you provided. Finally, you’ll review and electronically sign forms which make up the application submitted to Brighthouse for review. After you sign these forms you will be able to download or print them for your records.
